reviewText: League of Mermaids bored me.  I didn't even play a half-hour before wanting to never see it again.  And yet I'm recommending it.  I'm not recommending it because I enjoyed it, but because it performs exactly as advertised.   It's a physics-based ball-dropping game with a match-3 mechanic -- rather like a combination of Peggle without the pegs, a match-3, and Bubble Bobble.  It's very, VERY casual -- a minute to learn, perhaps two minutes to master -- and will be best for those seeking an undemanding, repetitive time-killer.  Even though I found the gameplay tedious, it does represent a reasonable game concept competently executed, and I won't thumbs-down it just because it's not to my tastes.

reviewText:
Game Information
League of Mermaids, is a match 3 game, developed by Alder Games and published by Legacy Games. But the actual full title for this is called League of Mermaids: Pearl Saga.

This is one of the kind match 3 game because of a special feature has implemented into the game. Physics is the special feature in this game. Whenever a match is made the nearby elements is effect by jostling them like a bunch of marbles in a jar.

Game Visuals
I want to mentioned that the visuals for this game is well done even its simplistic.

Game Audio
I want to mentioned that the audio for this game is well done even its simplistic and somewhat repetitive.

Gameplay
There are no game difficulty modes to choose from but each of the game levels has their own difficulty.

The game has a timer but all the levels still can be completed if the time on the timer has run out.

The story campaign mode there is total of three chapters with fifteen levels.

There are three extra chapters with fifteen levels each and they aren't related to the story campaign.

The zen mode provides untimed endless match 3 levels. Leveling up to the next level requires certain amount of stars. This mode can be seen as a stress reliever.

The bottomless trench mode. Is to see far the individual player can go until the time on the timer runs out. But there are some bonuses would help with the time and quickly help the individual player to go further.

The special puzzles mode features similar puzzles from the story campaign mode.

There are sixteen different achievements. But each of these achievements has certain requirements before they can be unlocked.

Miscellaneous
My final thoughts, this match 3 game, is definitely enjoyable to play. I would recommend this game but not at the full price value.

There is alot of achievements for the achievements hunters !  But watch out they wont be easy in this game . You will need luck and skills or even both sometimes to get the 3 stars on each level.
